Original: Do you remember the work you did
earlier concerning the remains of
a beast trapped within the ice?
[Page]
Your client then was a researcher who
is now requesting that you find for
him a [Color:5]book[Color:0] from the [Color:5]Echoing Library[Color:0].
[Page]
It is a very specific book, one which
contains diagrams of a [Color:5]double helix[Color:0].
Can I trust this matter to you?
[Page]
Good! Then I will trust you to find
success and shall await your swift
return.
Translation: Do you remember the work you did
earlier concerning the remains of
a beast trapped within the ice?
[Page]
Your client then was a researcher who
is now requesting that you find for
him a [Color:5]book[Color:0] from the [Color:5]Echoing Library[Color:0].
[Page]
It is a very specific book, one which
contains diagrams of a [Color:5]double helix[Color:0].
Can I trust this matter to you?
[Page]
Good! Then I will trust you to find
success and shall await your swift
return.

Original: Welcome back. Is that thick volume the
book your client requested?
[Page]
The Echoing Library has many books,
yes? I am surprised you found this
one in its stacks.
[Page]
I do wonder what the client intends to
do with this book... I hope it is
for research purposes only.
[Page]
I again thank you for your hard work.
I shall see that this gets to your
client.
Translation: Welcome back. Is that thick volume the
book your client requested?
[Page]
The Echoing Library has many books,
yes? I am surprised you found this
one in its stacks.
[Page]
I do wonder what the client intends to
do with this book... I hope it is
for research purposes only.
[Page]
I again thank you for your hard work.
I shall see that this gets to your
client.

Original: When you arrive at a dead end in the
ruins, you see a large bookshelf.
[Page]
You had accepted a request at the bar
concerning the delivery of a specific
old book...
[Page]
The book you are looking for may well
be in this bookshelf. If you wish, you
may search for it.
Translation: When you arrive at a dead end in the
ruins, you see a large bookshelf.
[Page]
You had accepted a request at the bar
concerning the delivery of a specific
old book...
[Page]
The book you are looking for may well
be in this bookshelf. If you wish, you
may search for it.

Original: A bookshelf towers before you...
[Page]
You consider searching its shelves
with the completion of the book
delivery request in mind.
Translation: A bookshelf towers before you...
[Page]
You consider searching its shelves
with the completion of the book
delivery request in mind.

Original: [Color:5]Check the bookshelf?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Check the bookshelf?[Color:0]

Original: As you pore over the shelves,
you notice one book in good
enough condition to be legible.
[Page]
You reach up and take it...
[Page]
But upon opening it, you see naught
but script in an unknown alphabet.
You gloomily return it to the shelf.
Translation: As you pore over the shelves,
you notice one book in good
enough condition to be legible.
[Page]
You reach up and take it...
[Page]
But upon opening it, you see naught
but script in an unknown alphabet.
You gloomily return it to the shelf.

Original: As you pore over the shelves,
you notice one book in good
enough condition to be legible.
[Page]
You reach up and take it...
[Page]
But upon opening it, it contains
naught but numerical formulae. With
a disappointed sigh, you put it back.
Translation: As you pore over the shelves,
you notice one book in good
enough condition to be legible.
[Page]
You reach up and take it...
[Page]
But upon opening it, it contains
naught but numerical formulae. With
a disappointed sigh, you put it back.

Original: As you pore over the shelves,
you notice one book in good
enough condition to be legible.
[Page]
You reach up and take it...
[Page]
The book contains several diagrams
involving double helices.
[Page]
There can be no doubt that this is
the book the client hoped to see!
[Page]
Quite pleased with yourself, you stow
the book in your pack and prepare to
return to the bar to report in.
Translation: As you pore over the shelves,
you notice one book in good
enough condition to be legible.
[Page]
You reach up and take it...
[Page]
The book contains several diagrams
involving double helices.
[Page]
There can be no doubt that this is
the book the client hoped to see!
[Page]
Quite pleased with yourself, you stow
the book in your pack and prepare to
return to the bar to report in.
